oldCode

Interface UserDataSource


  • public interface UserDataSource
    Provides functionality needed by any data source for the Address Book application.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addUser(User p)
      Adds a Person to the address list, if they are not already in the list
      void close()
      Finalizes any resources used by the data source and ensures data is persisited.
      void deleteUser(java.lang.String name)
      Deletes a Person from the address book.
      int getSize()
      Gets the number of addresses in the address book.
      User getUser(java.lang.String name)
      Extracts all the details of a Person from the address book based on the name passed in.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> nameSet()
      Retrieves a set of names from the data source that are used in the name list.

    • Method Detail

      • addUser

        void addUser(User p)
        Adds a Person to the address list, if they are not already in the list
        Parameters:
        p - Person to add

      • getUser

        User getUser(java.lang.String name)
        Extracts all the details of a Person from the address book based on the name passed in.
        Parameters:
        name - The name as a String to search for.
        Returns:
        all details in a Person object for the name

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        Gets the number of addresses in the address book.
        Returns:
        size of address book.

      • deleteUser

        void deleteUser(java.lang.String name)
        Deletes a Person from the address book.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to delete from the address book.

      • close

        void close()
        Finalizes any resources used by the data source and ensures data is persisited.

      • nameSet

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> nameSet()
        Retrieves a set of names from the data source that are used in the name list.
        Returns:
        set of names.
